Posted By: RafiqTheMiststalker (4/28/2010 8:55:28 PM)

posts.post_content:
The reason why Murkfiend Liege does not stack, as Merrow Commerce does, is because it is impossible to do anything during anybody's untap step. No player has priority, nor can any player play instants or activate abilities at instant speed during the untap step. Therefore, once the first Murkfiend Liege resolves, it is impossible to tap your creatures to have them untap with a second Murkfiend Liege.
  
   
302.2. No player receives priority during the untap step, so no spells or abilities can be played or
  
resolved. Any ability that triggers during this step will be held until a player would receive
  
priority during the upkeep step. (See rule 303, “Upkeep Step.”)
posts.html:
The reason why Murkfiend Liege does not stack, as Merrow Commerce does, is because it is impossible to do anything during anybody's untap step. No player has priority, nor can any player play instants or activate abilities at instant speed during the untap step. Therefore, once the first Murkfiend Liege resolves, it is impossible to tap your creatures to have them untap with a second Murkfiend Liege.

302.2. No player receives priority during the untap step, so no spells or abilities can be played or
resolved. Any ability that triggers during this step will be held until a player would receive
priority during the upkeep step. (See rule 303, “Upkeep Step.”)

Posted By: Mode (12/12/2009 8:55:20 AM)

posts.post_content:
@ Dorkus14  
*313.1. As the end of turn step begins, all abilities that trigger “at end of turn” go on the stack. (See rule  
410, “Handling Triggered Abilities.”) Then the active player gets priority and players may play  
spells and abilities.* (MagicCompRules090501)  
  
If my interpretation is correct, when you have two **Merrow Commerce**s out, both triggered abilities will go onto the stack as the end of turn step begins. You then have priority. If everyone passes, the first item on the stack (which is the first of the two untapping triggered abilities) resolves, untapping your Merfolk. You then get priority again before the second triggered ability resolves, which means that you could potentially use activated abilities with ![Tap](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=tap&type=symbol) in their cost before allowing the second untapping triggered ability to resolve.
posts.html:
@ Dorkus14
313.1. As the end of turn step begins, all abilities that trigger “at end of turn” go on the stack. (See rule
410, “Handling Triggered Abilities.”) Then the active player gets priority and players may play
spells and abilities. (MagicCompRules090501)

If my interpretation is correct, when you have two Merrow Commerces out, both triggered abilities will go onto the stack as the end of turn step begins. You then have priority. If everyone passes, the first item on the stack (which is the first of the two untapping triggered abilities) resolves, untapping your Merfolk. You then get priority again before the second triggered ability resolves, which means that you could potentially use activated abilities with in their cost before allowing the second untapping triggered ability to resolve.

posts.post_content:
Now if only there was an easy way to turn my lands into merfolk...  
  
Also, I'm surprised no one mentioned [Wake Thrasher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wake Thrasher). It keeps him beefy on your opponent's turns, making him harder to kill through combat or burn spells.
